intro: Spodiopogon lehmannii, commonly known as Lehmann's spikerush, is a perennial grass-like plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, where it thrives in moist, acidic soils. Its slender, grass-like stems are often clustered and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Spodiopogon lehmannii produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are arranged in spike-like clusters, typical of the sedge family.
